Project Overview

Featuring the creative process of UI and interaction design of Savor chai, a Café that offers multiple aromatic of chai-teas and variety of fusion flavors, stuffed in cheesy parathas(flatbread) that you can enjoy with your friends and family anytime early morning or later in the evening. Place is open to dine in and delivery is available to Chicagoland area and northern suburbs of Illinois.

TIMELINE

4 Weeks


PLATFORM

Website and mobile app,

TOOLS

Figma, Balsamiq, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, iPhone, Paper & Pen


MY ROLE

Competitive and comparative analysis, user journey, sketches, wireframes, user interface, interactive prototype.

Concept

So the story begins from my journey of moving to United States of America 7years ago. I liked alot of new things I got to discover in new country like smores and snow. But at the same time I began to miss alot of things from back home. Most importantly chai-tea as I happened to be Chai-fanatic, set out on a quest to find a cup of the traditional ‘Real Chai’. To quench this thirst of tea I ended up with a plan to introduce a real Chai in America so not only myself but others like me who miss real chai and everyone else may discover a new favorite too. Another element that sits well with the culture and theme of chai is paratha. Parathas are usually very plain and simple flatbread that can be enjoyed by itself but everyone may not find this simple combination worthy enough. So now the challenge is to reach as many tastebuds as possible, Since the aim is to serve all the different cultures residing in USA and bring everyone together.. So I decided to have variety of fusions by combining different fillings in the parathas like phillycheese steak, Mexican style, pepperoni pizza, vegetarian. Even when it comes to chai, different flavors are offered like pinknut, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger and special savor’s chai which is simple strong bend of brewed tea and milk.

Strategy

Target Audience

Strategy -Target Audience

  • College students
  • Busy working folks
  • Young parents

Role

  • People who love trying new food
  • Who want treat during their busy work/study schedu

Demographics

  • GENDER - both
  • EDUCATION - Any
  • OCCUPATION - Any
  • AGE - 16-40
  • LOCATION - Chicagoland and suburbs of Illinois

Psychographics

  • Personality & Attitudes: Food lovers, Modern, Adventurous
  • Values: Active, Efficient, Outgoing
  • Lifestyles: Hangout with friends, love to try different culture food, love travelling

Research Interviews


Interviews - 5

Survey Respondents - 20


Interview Analysis

Insights

I conducted five interviews with college going students and young parents that work full or part times.
• We had a better understanding of how important is to get meals on the table everyday specially during hectic schedule, It’s always convenient to get flavorful meals from outside.
• Two of them said their partners usually prefers different origin of food. They end up paying extra for deliveries due to ordering from two different restaurants. “ I like bbq chicken but he always want phillycheese steak. No one wants to sacrifice their cravings after a long day”

Data Analysis From Surveys

Insights

    • Majority of them like to have easy access to order food at home for convenience.
    • Almost all of them prefer food that Is filling and reasonable at the same time.
    • Drinking tea/coffee is major part of their routine to keep them going.
    • Customization of ingredients to their liking is always a bonus

We determined from our surveys that we could make the impact with minimal change to our business model of this restaurant.

Personas

Alex Shane
Age 19

Alex is a first year accounting student at Depaul University. He plans to achieve CPA certification and work in one of the big accounting firm. He is single, works part time at hotel's front desk makes about $22k/yr. He loves food and has interests to try food from different restaurants of the world. He doesn't get chance to cook so usually prefers to eat out with his friends on daily basis and with family on weekends. He is active on social media and loves checking out new food places.

Sara Hocane
Age 27

Sara is a full-time graduate student at the Northwestern University in pursuing a career in health care. She makes about $60k/yr and she is newly married. She likes to go outdoor and try new food, or hiking new trails. She usually misses her traditional food that her mom use to make back home. She tries her best to cook at home but usually ends up calling food deliveries on her busy working days. She moderately active on social media to stay connected with family.

Rose Alison
Age 38

Rose is mom of two and works as a pharmacy technician. She makes 45k/yr while her husband is a businessman. Rose likes to paint and go out for shopping. Life is hectic to juggle between kids school homework and her own job, so she finds ordering food at home very convenient. She loves to spend weekend going to the parks and beaches with her family. She also runs a mom blog on Instagram and usually gets businesses attention to review and promote their products.

USER NEEDS

The website needs to enable the user to:

  • Know when restaurant is open for dine and delivery/pickup.
  • Order food online easily
  • Choose from variety of flavors according to preference.
  • See the menu’s every item has details about ingredients for better understanding.
  • Opt Interesting discounted deals every week on homepage
  • Be able customize by Addition and deduction of ingredients

CLIENT NEEDS

The website needs to enable the client to:

  • To sell food online that will be delivered/picked up
  • As many as possible flavors and ingredients provided to satisfy specific cravings.
  • See new deals updated regularly to encourage repeat customers.
  • Reasonable cost and discount offers for users who like to spend carefully.
  • Have Customer support system
  • Customization available upon request

Content Requirements

“The user will be looking for…”

  • Bussiness hours
  • Delivery availability and Location
  • Ingredients and prices of displayed items
  • Food menu and images
  • About us page
  • Description Paratha and chai
  • Look for new combo deals
  • Contact & location Information page

Functionality Requirements

  • Choose from the list of items
  • Look at the detail of ingredients
  • Look at the prices of each item
  • Add items to cart for delivery or pickup
  • See status of their order
  • See timings for dine in and status of wait-time if busy
  • Access to view discount deal of the Combination meal
  • Contact information for customization of ingredients or any other queries

USER JOURNEY

Design Scope

Theme

Choosing colors for designs in general is not easy. I had to prioritize the colorful theme of truck art for this restaurant’s design. I began with creating an illustration of colorful kettle and cup as an inspiration after following the moodboard. I began with setting every component bright but it felt too overblown. So realizing can’t just choose colors for this project based on how I feel about them. I decided to let the overall layout simple and distribute some lively pop of colors throughout in the background paattern or buttons and pictures so the design compliments the theme without causing fatigue to the eyes. I’ve become more aware that knowing color theory, preferences and background of the client, culture of users and comprehension of your audience and competitors is the best way to choose right color for your project.

Order for delivery/pickup

This restaurant is suppose to be open for dine in as well as for delivery/pickup. So to include the ordering system in our digital solution, First I organized the feature of adding food items to cart to order online directly from the menu by placing “add to cart” button under each item. But it gave it a glance of more like an online restaurant so I ended up omitting that pattern.
Whenever I visit a restaurant/café to dine in for dinner, I like to look at the menu on the website beforehand. So I won’t find add to cart option under each item useful.

Solution

I placed a single large button “place order” at the end of menu for users who would specifically like to order online so this button would take the user directly to the cart where they can fill their cart with personal choice of Paratha and chai by scroll down options.

Sketches

Wireframes

Wireframes are used early in the development process to establish the basic structure of an project before visual design and content is added. In the ideation phase I created wireframes presenting information architecture of the future layout.

Final Interface

Finally, after all researches and analysis were done I focused on designing all the screens through which a user will move, and created the visual elements — and their interactive properties — that facilitate this movement. I used things like patterns, spacing and color to guide the user and designed visual, interactive elements that respond in a way that feels natural to the user.
